column4: plz help trying to install a program and get the following error: /bin/tar: -b1: Not found in archive
any ideas?
anuyone who could help?
you get that when you do what.
didn't understand
what do you do to get that error.
trying to install a program
running a setup.sh
please try to be specific.
ok:
i run a setup.sh and it asks installation directory, i put a desired one and then get that error
installation script for what
to install a program
I give up.
nice way to treat a nob
installation scripts are for installing programs.  I asked you to be specific.  I can't help you.
i'm trying to... u don't help me be specif i can't imagine what's the info u r looking for
I want to know what you're trying to install.
now are tuned up i think, it's an electronic design software, sth like a CAD

whatever is going wrong is a problem with the setup script (apparently).  there's nothing more I can tell you withing knowing what software it is so I can peek at the setup script, and I've lost interest in beating that information out of you.
ok have fun
wish everyone were as helpful as u
help me help you.  ask answerable questions.  be specific.  something like "I did _______ and ______ happened.  I read the ______ docs and tried ______ but it didn't help.  what am I doing wrong?"
